problem_text:
Is every finitely presented soluble group nilpotent-by-nilpotent-by-finite?
J. R. J. Groves
answer: No: for a prime p the group G = ⟨a, b, c, d | ba = bp, ca = cp, da = d, cb = c, dc = ddb, [d, db] = 1, dp = 1⟩ is soluble of derived length 3, but is not metanilpotent-by-finite. (V. V. Bludov, Letter of 27 April 2007.)
